snippet.title: The Gettysburg Civil War battle lives again
snippet.description: Road Trip 2010: If it's Fourth of July weekend, that means it's time to reenact one of the most famous battles of the Civil War. CNET's Daniel Terdiman is on hand to see the action.

snippet.title: Foxconn set for US with $40M investment in Pennsylvania
snippet.description: The Chinese company will invest $30 million over two years to build a manufacturing facility, and will also drop $10 million into R&D at Carnegie Mellon.

snippet.title: Teenage Engineering OD-11
snippet.description: Building of a speaker design by Swedish audio engineer Stig Carlsson, Teenage Engineering's minimalist OD-11 aims to stream music directly from the cloud.

snippet.title: At Raytheon, where engineering rules
snippet.description: Road Trip 2010: The defense giant encourages openness among its 40,000-plus engineers as it tackles tech issues in areas from missiles to radar to semiconductors.

snippet.title: Intel to ax 1,500 jobs in Costa Rica
snippet.description: The chipmaker's closure of a Costa Rice assembly-and-test operation is part of a plan to cut costs and shift Intel's focus from PCs to mobile.

snippet.title: Big guns of the Civil War (pictures)
snippet.description: On the 150th anniversary of the battle of Gettysburg this week, we look at some artillery pieces and other weapons from the American Civil War.

snippet.title: Dyson design finalists: Engineering tomorrow
snippet.description: Selective noise canceling and luggage made from wool waste. Have a look at some of this year's finalists for the James Dyson Award, an international competition for next-gen designers.

snippet.title: NSA job post for 'Civil Liberties & Privacy Officer' goes live
snippet.description: The scandal surrounding the US National Security Agency is no laughing matter, of course. But it's hard not to look for telling lines in the agency's new job listing.

snippet.title: Android engineering manager is Yahoo's latest acquisition
snippet.description: The Android Open Source Project's technical lead, Jean-Baptiste Queru, bolts for Yahoo following a public denouncement of strife between Google and hardware partners.

snippet.title: Facebook's engineering director departs company
snippet.description: Josh Wiseman, a longtime Facebooker, said he wants to work on a "more tangible social problem."
